acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=9mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,750mg/kg (BUA 179 (1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category 2B by the Japan Society for Occupational Health (2004) and as Category R by NTP (2005).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF<2(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 2.6%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rat and mouse teratogenicity tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003)): Thyroid gland hyperplasia and adverse effects on the central/peripheral nervous systems, skeleton and eyes are observed in the embryo, but no data are available on the maternal toxicity.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild irritation" from rabbit primary eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003): Irritation is observed in some cases, while not in other.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in CICAD No.49 (2003): The substance causes skin sensitization in humans.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (thyroid)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "facial edema (a symptom of hypothyroidism), hypotension, bradycardia, abnormal electrocardiogram associated with a decrease in basal metabolic rate, constipation, abdominal bloating, polyuria, agranulocytosis associated with an increase in lymphocyte/monocyte count" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "irritation to respiratory organs" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.49 (2003)).
